com.almasb.fxgl.effect

Class ParticleEmitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.fxgl.effect.ParticleEmitter

  • public class ParticleEmitter
extends Object
    A general particle emitter. The configuration is done via setters, which allow changing how the particle is emitted and rendered.
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

      • getRandomSize

        protected final double getRandomSize()
        Returns:
        random size between min and max size

      • setSize

        public final void setSize(double min,
                          double max)
        Set size to particles. The created size will be a random value between min (incl) and max (excl).
        Parameters:
        min - minimum size
        max - maximum size

      • getColorFunction

        public final Supplier<javafx.scene.paint.Paint> getColorFunction()
        Returns:
        particles color function

      • setColorFunction

        public final void setColorFunction(Supplier<javafx.scene.paint.Paint> colorFunction)
        Set color function to particles created by this emitter. The supplier function will be invoked every time a new particle is emitted.
        Parameters:
        colorFunction - particles color function.

      • getGravityFunction

        public final Supplier<javafx.geometry.Point2D> getGravityFunction()
        Returns:
        gravity function

      • setGravityFunction

        public final void setGravityFunction(Supplier<javafx.geometry.Point2D> gravityFunction)
        Set gravity function. The supplier function is invoked every time when a new particle is spawned. Adds gravitational pull to particles. Once created the particle's movement will be biased towards the vector.
        Parameters:
        gravityFunction - gravity vector supplier function
        Default Value:
        (0, 0)

      • setVelocityFunction

        public final void setVelocityFunction(TriFunction<Integer,Double,Double,javafx.geometry.Point2D> velocityFunction)
        Set initial velocity function. Particles when spawned will use the function to obtain initial velocity.
        Parameters:
        velocityFunction - the velocity function

      • setSpawnPointFunction

        public final void setSpawnPointFunction(TriFunction<Integer,Double,Double,javafx.geometry.Point2D> spawnPointFunction)
        Particles will use the function to obtain spawn points.
        Parameters:
        spawnPointFunction - supplier of spawn points

      • setScaleFunction

        public final void setScaleFunction(TriFunction<Integer,Double,Double,javafx.geometry.Point2D> scaleFunction)
        Scale function defines how the size of particles change over time.
        Parameters:
        scaleFunction - scaling function

      • setExpireFunction

        public final void setExpireFunction(TriFunction<Integer,Double,Double,javafx.util.Duration> expireFunction)
        Expire function is used to obtain expire time for particles.
        Parameters:
        expireFunction - function to supply expire time

      • setBlendFunction

        public final void setBlendFunction(TriFunction<Integer,Double,Double,javafx.scene.effect.BlendMode> blendFunction)
        Blend function is used to obtain blend mode for particles.
        Parameters:
        blendFunction - blend supplier function

      • setSourceImage

        public void setSourceImage(javafx.scene.image.Image sourceImage)
        Set source image for this emitter to produce particles.
        Parameters:
        sourceImage - the image
        Default Value:
        null

      • getNumParticles

        public final int getNumParticles()
        Returns:
        number of particles being spawned per emission

      • setNumParticles

        public final void setNumParticles(int numParticles)
        Set number of particles being spawned per emission.
        Parameters:
        numParticles - number of particles

      • setEmissionRate

        public final void setEmissionRate(double emissionRate)
        Set the emission rate. The value will be effectively clamped to [0..1].
      • 1.0 - emission will occur every frame
      • 0.5 - emission will occur every 2nd frame
      • 0.33 - emission will occur every 3rd frame
      • 0.0 - emission will never occur
        • etc.
Parameters:
emissionRate - emission rate

  • rand

    protected final double rand()
    Returns a value in [0..1).
    Returns:
    random value between 0 (incl) and 1 (excl)

    protected final double rand(double min,
                            double max)
    Returns a value in [min..max).
    Parameters:
    min - min bounds
    max - max bounds
    Returns:
    a random value between min (incl) and max (excl)
